Indications 
(From 8.1.1 Alkylating drugs: British National Formulary)
Treosulfan is given by mouth or by intravenous or intraperitoneal administration and is used to treat ovarian cancer. Skin pigmentation is a common side-effect and allergic alveolitis, pulmonary fibrosis and haemorrhagic cystitis occur rarely.
name: TREOSULFAN
cautions:
Cautions see section 8.1;
avoid in acute porphyria (but see section 9.8.2)
side-effects: Side-effects see section 8.1 and notes above
pregnancy:
Pregnancy avoid; see also Pregnancy and Reproductive
